item.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Places Second In January 2026 Nintendo Charts (US)
item.content:encoded:
It also made the "Top 10 Best-Selling Games" of last month

It's a new year, and following new releases in January 2026, Circana's Mat Piscatella has now shared chart data for the "Top 10 Best-Selling Premium Games" on Nintendo platforms in the US for this same month.

As you can see, Square Enix's latest Switch 2 release Final Fantasy VII Remake Intergrade has debuted in second place, below Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A, and ahead of Donkey Kong Bananza. Keep in mind Nintendo's first-party titles here do not factor in the digital sales, and these charts do not include specific sales data.

Final Fantasy VII Remake also went from 225th place in December to 9th place in January - cracking the "Top 20 Best-Selling Premium Games" in the US for January 2026. This was thanks to the combined efforts of the Switch 2 and Xbox releases. Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A has dropped from sixth place to 16th place in the "Top 20" this month.

Piscatella has provided some additional information about hardware performance, revealing Switch 2 spending was able to offset year-on-year declines across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S and Switch. In saying this, PlayStation 5 still led the market.

"Hardware spending increased 16% when compared to a year ago, reaching $248M. Nintendo Switch 2 spending was able to offset year-on-year declines seen across PlayStation 5 (-17%), Xbox Series (-27%) and Switch (-79%).

"Despite sales falling compared to a year ago, PlayStation 5 led the hardware market in both unit and dollar sales during January 2026. Nintendo Switch 2 ranked 2nd across both measures."

In case you missed it, Final Fantasy VII Rebirth recently got a release date for the Switch 2. There's also a demo you can check out for the first game via the Switch eShop, and if you want to know even more about it, be sure to read (or watch) our review here on Nintendo Life.

Did you pick up Final Fantasy or any other Switch 2 or Switch games last month? Let us know in the comments.

[source bsky.app]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer on Nintendo Life. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2026/02/final-fantasy-vii-remake-places-second-in-january-2026-nintendo-charts-us

item.title: Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection ‚ÄòGo Forth‚Äô trailer, developer walkthrough
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A 13-minute introduction with lead gameplay designer Daisuke Wakahara.

Capcom has released a new story trailer and 13-minute developer walkthrough video for turn-based RPG sequel Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection.

The developer walkthrough with lead gameplay designer Daisuke Wakahara introduces everything from the story to the player‚Äôs role within it, creating a character, advanced battle tactics, egg hunting, Habitat Restoration, and more.

Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam on March 13.

Watch the videos below.

item.title: Gallery: Here's A Look At Pok√©mon FireRed And LeafGreen On Switch
item.content:encoded:
In the lead up to Pok√©mon's 30th anniversary celebration, Nintendo officially lifted the lid on the return of Pok√©mon FireRed and LeafGreen.

They're arriving on the Switch eShop on 27th February 2026, and ahead of this release, Nintendo has shared not only an official trailer but also some direct screenshots, showing off how both games will look on its hybrid system.

As we previously mentioned, Nintendo has also confirmed these Switch releases contain the same content as the original releases, with some modern solutions to the connectivity features. You can also play these titles while using the GameChat feature.

If you somehow haven't played these monster-catching RPG before, as you can see below, it's a mix of adventure, exploration and battling wrapped up in some lovely pixel artwork! So, without further ado, here's a look:

Pok√©mon FireRed and LeafGreen preorders and now live, and you can also preload these games on your Switch, if you've already purchased them. If you haven't already bought them, they'll set you back ¬£16.99 / $19.99 each (or your regional equivalent).

You can check out the trailer and a side-by-side opening video in our previous coverage here on Nintendo Life.

Are you looking forward to the return of these games? Have you already purchased them? Let us know in the comments.



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2026/02/gallery-heres-a-look-at-pokemon-firered-and-leafgreen-on-switch

item.title: The Best Deals Today: Donkey Kong Bananza, Zojirushi Rice Cooker, Ghost of Yotei, and More
item.content:encoded:
Big discounts for days.

The weekend is finally here, and new deals have popped up as a result! There are quite a few solid discounts across the board, including savings on Donkey Kong Bananza, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, and even a Zojirushi rice cooker. Check out our top picks for Saturday, February 21, below.

Save $10 on Donkey Kong Bananza for Switch 2

Donkey Kong Bananza - Nintendo Switch 2

Donkey Kong Bananza was, without a doubt, one of the best games of 2025. It had been decades since DK had received a 3D entry, and Nintendo did not hold anything back with Bananza. This inventive platformer brought the act of destruction, allowing DK to punch and smash his way through any surface on his quest to the center of the planet. You can save $10 off a Switch 2 copy today at Woot!

Ghost of Yotei for $49.99

Ghost of Yotei

Ghost of Yotei has hit its first major sale at PS Direct, with copies available for $49.99. This second entry in the Ghost franchise brings a new protagonist, Atsu, plus a new region of Hokkaido. In our 8/10 review, we wrote, "A predictable but well-executed story takes you through Ghost of Yotei's gorgeous landscapes and satisfying, fluid action ‚Äì it may not be revolutionizing open world games, but it's a great distillation of the samurai fantasy."

Save 28% Off This Zojirushi Rice Cooker

Zojirushi NP-HCC18XH Induction Heating System Rice Cooker and Warmer

Zojirushi rice cookers are often known as the best brand around, and Amazon has a sweet deal on this model for a limited time. You can save over $100 off this rice cooker, which can hold 1.8 L / 10 cups uncooked rice. This is the perfect appliance for perfect rice every time, or a quick all-in-one meal during the busy week.

Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition Out Now

Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition ‚Äì Nintendo Switch 2 Edition Upgrade Pack

Nintendo shadow dropped Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition this week, bringing support for 4K60FPS to the 2025 release. The upgrade pack is available now for $4.99 on the Nintendo eShop, with a physical copy due out in April. Unfortunately, there are some visual smoothing and shimmering issues thanks to heavy MSAA use, but Nintendo and Monolith Soft will likely bring a patch forward in the near future to address this.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater for $29.99

METAL GEAR SOLID Œî: SNAKE EATER TACTICAL ED ‚Äì PS5

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater was one of the most faithful remakes of 2025. You can save $40 MSRP this weekend at Amazon, as PS5 copies have dropped to $29.99. With Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 2's release set for August, now is the time to check out the Snake Eater remake.

Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze for $39.88

Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze - Nintendo Switch

Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze is one of the best games on the Nintendo Switch, and you can pick up a copy today for $39.88 at Walmart. If you played Donkey Kong Bananza on Switch 2 and are searching for another adventure with DK and friends, Tropical Freeze is an amazing choice.

The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening for $39.88

The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening - Nintendo Switch

The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening is one of the best Zelda games on Nintendo Switch. This Presidents Day weekend, you can score a copy of the game at Walmart for $39.88. If you're playing on Nintendo Switch 2, you can play the game at 60FPS with a higher frame rate in both docked and handheld modes.

Recommends

In This Article

item.title: Today‚Äôs Strands #720 Hints and Answers for February 21, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6√ó8 letter grid.

Whether it‚Äôs your first time playing or you‚Äôre a Strands veteran, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Strands, don‚Äôt worry, below you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #720 for Saturday, February 21, 2026

To play today‚Äôs Strands, head to the game‚Äôs website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs edition of Strands. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There‚Äôs also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don‚Äôt fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 21, 2026

The Strands‚Äô answers for Game #720 are all about beer and the practice of making your own beer. This is the perfect puzzle for any microbrewers out there. This puzzle has nine answers, and I needed some help with some of them. So, if you need some guidance, just keep reading.

General Strands Hints For February 21

Without giving today‚Äôs Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: One of the answers for today‚Äôs puzzle is a basic necessity of life. Most of the Earth is comprised of this, and so are you.
  • Hint 2: A famous song by The Archies is about this sweet ingredient.
  • Hint 3: The Spanagram isn‚Äôt just related to brewing, but also about developing new games for old hardware and other fan projects.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #720 for February 21, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 21, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • HEAT
  • FLARE
  • MALL
  • HOPE
  • BARE

Today‚Äôs Strands Answer For Game #720 On February 21, 2026

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today‚Äôs Strands below.

  • WHEAT
  • BARLEY
  • MALT
  • WATER
  • SUGAR
  • HOPS
  • YEAST
  • FLAVOR
  • SPANAGRAM: HOMEBREW

If you solved today‚Äôs Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #720?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 22 will be Strands Game #721.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6√ó8 letter grid. The game‚Äôs original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle‚Äôs success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Iron Lung Film Composer Andrew Hulshult On Working with Markiplier, Differences Between Games and Film OSTs
item.content:encoded:
Andrew Hulshult: For many boomer shooter fans, he's known as THE guy for soundtracks in that genre. When his name flashed on the screen during the opening credits of Iron Lung, I was surprised to learn one of my favorite composers was involved with this project. As the credits rolled at the end of the film, the gears started whirring in my head: I really want to talk to him about this film's soundtrack.

As it turns out, going from strictly video game OSTs to film was as unexpected for Hulshult as it was for me finding out he composed for Iron Long. And so, after asking around, I was able to talk to the man himself and learn more about his process of composing for film versus video games, the challenges he faced, and the fun he had while on Iron Lung's set. 

On the Set of Iron Lung

Unless you're deep into the boomer shooter space, you might not know of Hulshult's connection to Iron Lung game creator David Szymanski. The film wasn't their first creative endeavor together -- Hulshult composed the soundtrack for the gritty, dark, retro-style shooter Dusk, the very game that put Szymanski on the map. 

Around 2018 or 2019, after Dusk's development, Hulshult would often casually tell Szymanski that it would be cool to do a score for a film, if the chance ever arose. While we don't have a movie for Dusk (at least, not yet), around 2022, Hulshult got a call from Szymanski about a different project.

"He called me and was like, 'hey, you remember how you said you wanted to work on a film?' He's like, 'so what if I told you you could and that I think that you'd be perfect for it?' And I was like, I'm thinking [it's a] small thing, 'I'm like... yeah, what do you got.' He's like, well, Markiplier."

Markiplier is a massive presence on YouTube and beyond. With nearly 40 million subscribers on YouTube alone, anything with his name behind it pulls a lot of weight. Even while writing this article, he's streaming a horror game and pulling a staggering 90,000 viewers. So, for him to be involved, Hulshult knew it was a big deal, and was eager to jump into this project, that being Iron Lung.

"It was sick, man, like it was so much fun," said Hulshult. "That guy is a constant creative, is always looking for something to better the project without going too crazy into it, is always open to ideas, is always looking for suggestions, and it's just been awesome."

Hulshult later had a chance to visit the set of Iron Lung, where he was able to get inspiration and ideas for the music. For about a minute, he felt like an outsider on set, but almost immediately, he grew comfortable with the professionalism and friendliness of the crew. 

Not to mention, Hulshult was blown away by the dynamic set -- a sub rigged into a machine that could create the feeling of underwater turbulence -- and seeing it all in action over the course of a week served as incredible inspiration for his music.

"It was awesome to be asked to come on the set just to write demos. And I will tell you that about half the demos I wrote under that, I never touched again, and they just made it into the film. We just liked them. I was just catching vibes off of Mark's acting that I was like, I genuinely did not think that I would catch. I was connecting with that dude's performances on a different level."

Aspects from the set made it into Hulshult's music, as well. Giant vats of artificial blood, latex, metal, and even Markiplier's own voice contributed to the score. By sampling these sounds, Hulshult worked some dark magic and created the ominous, brooding sounds we hear in the Iron Lung OST. 

I was just catching vibes off of Mark's acting that I was like, I genuinely did not think that I would I would catch I was I was connecting with that dude's performances on a different level.

"And I would feed in all of those sounds into granular synthesis," said Hulshult, "and just mess with them until I found something that sounded like a note that I enjoyed, but still sounded like, you know, metal or a sub or Mark's voice. And then I would just use it, and it kind of became like a little bit of a meme where I was like, I'm going to go home and write music with this metallic shitty orchestra for this film, is what we always say."

Composing for Video Games vs. Film

At various points during our talk, we touched on the differences between composing for video game music versus film. Hulshult has credits for over a dozen games, including the aforementioned Dusk, but also the recent Heretic + Hexen Remaster by Nightdive, and even Doom Eternal's The Ancient Gods DLC.

"You can't operate this the exact same way," said Hulshult. "You can't come to it the exact same way. You have to come to it and talk about the vision, like what this guy's vision is, and understand it to a point where you don't even need him in the room, which I feel like I got to that. And every time that I would have a piece of music, I just sent it over to him, and he loved almost all of it all the way through, which I was like, thank god, it's my first time. This could have gone so sideways."

Because of Hulshult's experience in the industry, he mentions there is an established trust between him and the video game producers he works with. Of course, video games and film are completely different forms of entertainment, which was one hurdle he had to get around. 

"...so like films, it is a lot more static, but the the issue with films is that they can change, so you can get cuts, right? Like something can completely change in a week, and you've got to rethink it. And with games, it's not so much that. It's like, this is the level, this is how we want to do stuff. So you can kind of write what's in your head front to back, almost all in one go."

One distinct aspect about Iron Lung is that it takes place completely within one self-contained submarine, whereas Hulshult is normally composing for video games with sprawling levels and dynamic themes. This was intimidating, especially given the fact that music was critical in creating the atmosphere for the film. 

"It's been a while since I had like a really good challenge," said Hulshult. "Eternal felt like a really good challenge, those DLC felt like a really good challenge, and I think I was ready for another big challenge and that's what excited me about this."

I think I was ready for another big challenge and that's what excited me about this.

Hulshult commends the cinematography and editing of the film, making use of such a small space to constantly innovate and thus keep the audience engaged. In addition to the excellent work by Markiplier as director and his team, Iron Lung game creator David Szymanski served a pivotal role in the process as well. 

Szymanski not only developed the gameplay for Iron Lung, he also created the music as well. For research, Hulshult went back and listened to Szymanski's work, which he calls "weird, interesting and really dreadful." 

There was a particular motif from the theme song of Iron Lung that stuck with him, and curious about how Szymanski created a certain whirring sound, Hulshult was shocked to learn it was sampled by an old fan. 

"And that changed how I perceived everything with the soundtrack," said Hulshult, "that little tiny interaction with David Szymanski, because I was sitting back here going, 'I'm about to write like music for a movie -- I gotta go find all these crazy string libraries and we gotta go find the coolest synths that we can, we're going to go spend some money.

And immediately was like, nope: We're going to work on sound design, is what we're going to do. We're going to find weird sounds that are related to either the set or the sub, and we're going to write with that."

The Unprecedented Reception of Iron Lung

Iron Lung's film adaptation has been nothing short of a rousing success. With a smaller budget of $3 million and created by a YouTuber -- not an established director -- Iron Lung's accrued nearly $50 million in revenue. In a heartfelt, tear-filled video by Markiplier, he reflects on the film's monumental performance. By extension, Hulshult's been blown away by it all as well, calling it the "biggest reception" he's ever had with his music. 

"A bunch of people didn't know that I was going to be writing the music for this," said Hulshult, "and they're like tagging me like, 'oh my God, you wrote for this? ' And they're in the theater. And I'm just, I really wanted to write back: 'Please just watch the movie, send it to me afterwards.'"

"Anytime I can be a part of something cool with cool people and people want to talk about it for a few years down the road, I'm all for it, that's what it is for me. If we made a big enough impact to where you're like, I got to talk about this, that's cool. I love that."

Be sure to check out our full video interview if you're interested in the entire conversation with Andrew Hulshult, including more details on his time on set and his creative process for both video games and film music! If you're interested in hearing Hulshult's score, you can find it on major streaming sites such as Spotify.



https://techraptor.net/gaming/interviews/iron-lung-film-composer-andrew-hulshult-on-working-with-markiplier-differences
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: The Legend Of Zelda‚Äôs Keeps Flirting With Dumping Fantasy For Sci-Fi
item.content:encoded:
Today marks the 40th anniversary of The Legend of Zelda. Originally released for the Famicom Disk System in 1986, Nintendo‚Äôs ambitious adventure kicked off the most beloved high-fantasy video game series of them all. Through decades, the tunic-wearing hero has slain stalfos, obliterated octoroks, and harassed cuccos. But behind all the sword and sorcery lies another campaign in waiting, an adventure Link has never braved but come very close to undertaking: some outer space shit.

In 2017, Breath of the Wild director Hidemaro Fujibayashi, art director Satoru Takizawa and technical director Takuhiro Dohta gave a keynote at GDC. It offered a rare and candid glimpse at the production behind the latest (and to some, greatest) Legend of Zelda, released only a few days prior. Getting a peak behind the curtain at how the toybox of physics and elemental effects came to be was a treat, but one of the more bizarre parts of the talk regarded an earlier pitch.

In a segment called ‚ÄúTrial and Error,‚Äù Takizawa reviews concepts for a version of the game called The Legend of Zelda: INVASION. ‚ÄúThis is where things got a bit dodgy,‚Äù Takizawa said. ‚ÄúAnd here‚Äôs an invasion from outer space.‚Äù

As chuckling swells in the crowd, bizarre slides of this would-be Zelda cycle. It features a UFO descending on to Hyrule, a storyboard for an alien autopsy, spacesuits and Ganondorf in what appears to be a Metallica t-shirt. Most offensive of all were slides of the most fuckboy Link ever developed. Dressed like a frosh week volunteer, Link dons baggy denim pants, a striped winter hat, a Triforce guitar and a motorcycle. To think we came this close to a Link with a Superbad poster in his room still gives me chills.

The Legend of Zelda is 40 today ü§Ø
*check notes on space*

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild (2017): UFO concept, artist unknown
Art director Satoru Takizawa: "Some of our younger designers came up with very unique suggestions, like the idea that UFOs could invade from space and abduct cattle.‚Äù

‚Äî The Spaceshipper üöÄ (@thespaceshipper.com) 2026-02-21T10:15:00.535Z

Thankfully we got the incredible game we got instead, but it‚Äôs probably no coincidence that Takizawa brought up INVASION when discussing the design for Breath of the Wild‚Äôs ancient ruins and Guardians. Sheikah technology has a strong, otherworldly and out-of-place appearance to it. Mechanical octopus arms. Ominous glowing spotlights. Metallurgy so distant to the masonry everywhere else. Hell, Link‚Äôs main weapon is a damn smartphone. It always felt like some of the sci-fi elements remained deep in Hyrule‚Äôs soil, built by ancient visitors.

This Stargate-aside wasn‚Äôt The Legend of Zelda‚Äôs only near miss with a different genre. Fact is, since day one Shigeru Miyamoto considered giving The Legend of Zelda a harder sci-fi bent. In an interview with the French publication Gamekult, Miyamoto confirmed that the series‚Äô original idea revolved around time travel.

Obviously time travel is a frequent occurrence, but this initial concept is less Ocarina and more Back to the Future Part II. This plot seemingly concerns a bygone era of steel and shield rubbing up against strange future devices, and the source of the Triforce‚Äôs incredible magic being microchips and computer parts. In that same conversation, Miyamoto even muses that Breath of the Wild producer Eiji Aonuma might have added the Sheikah Slate as a kind of callback to this original idea. 1992‚Äôs A Link to the Past got so close to Link facing off against flying cars that concept art was drafted for a tubular, ‚Äò90s, cyberpunk Princess Zelda, resurfacing in 2013‚Äôs Hyrule Historia. Come to think of it, the title A Link to the Past would make a lot more sense for a game about time travel than one in which you merely hop between a good dimension and a scary dimension.

After 40 years, it feels unlikely that Nintendo will send Link, Zelda, Tingle, all our Hyrule friends spiraling into wormholes and far off nebulas now. When Hylians land on the moon, it usually means the moon came to the Hyrule. Nintendo has reigned in their style guide before. As they venture into movies, Netflix shows and theme parks I expect them to only become more conservative on what their IPs do and do not do. Still, as much as INVASION‚Äôs Link‚Ä¶ disturbs me, I am that steadfast Jackie Brown and Ed Wood are their best movies kind of hack who finds that great artists often do their greatest work beyond the comfort zone. Throughout the ages, people who work on Zelda seem to dream of one day lobbing Link into the cold void of space. Perhaps, one day, they will get their wish.



https://kotaku.com/legend-zelda-sci-fi-concept-art-40th-anniversary-2000672580
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Xbox CEO Wants to Develop Stories With Emotional Resonance
item.content:encoded:
New Microsoft Gaming CEO Asha Sharma discusses what she likes in video games. She also admits she‚Äôs got a lot to learn in her new role.

Asha Sharma became the head of Xbox on February 20, 2026, following a shake-up that saw Phil Spencer retire and Sarah Bond leave the company. She‚Äôs tried to be an engaging CEO in her first 24 hours, outlining her vision for AI in Xbox‚Äôs future and responding to gamers on social media. Still, her background at Microsoft saw her leading the CoreAI division.

Before Microsoft, she held top positions for Instacart and Meta. While those are successful companies, they don‚Äôt exactly scream ‚Äúgaming.‚Äù As such, Sharma knows she has a lot to learn in her new position.

Asha Sharma on What She Likes to See in Video Games

In an interview with Variety, Sharma was quoted as saying that she likes games with deep emotional resonance. She also touted the game Firewatch as a game that resonated with her emotionally.

Sharma plans to win over core Xbox gamers and earn the right to be trusted. She hopes to develop consistency over time that will lead to a stronger relationship with the player base. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm coming into gaming as a platform builder,‚Äù Sharma noted.

In response to a social media comment, she even listed her three favorite games: Halo, Valheim, and GoldenEye.

Moving forward, she will work closely with Matt Booty to enact her initiatives. Sarah Bond will assist her and provide guidance during the transition before her exit from Microsoft. Learn more about Sarah‚Äôs departure from Microsoft at this link.

Learn more about Phil Spencer‚Äôs retirement and Xbox‚Äôs restructuring at this link. Check out Asha Sharma‚Äôs full memo to her team following the shakeups here.

What are your thoughts on the future of Xbox? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: WWE 2K26 MyFACTION Designer Talks Microtransactions
item.content:encoded:
WWE 2K26 will once again include MyFACTION, a single-player mode that competes with NBA 2K‚Äôs MyTeam and EA Sports FC‚Äôs Ultimate Team. It offers a collection-oriented experience centered on in-game trading cards.

Players start with a specific pack of wrestlers and then use in-game points or virtual currency to purchase new packs that improve their team.

As with most sports and live-service games in 2026, microtransactions are part of the experience. In the case of WWE games, microtransactions will allow you to get a specific card of a specific player needed for a specific event. Now, the team behind the mode is discussing their philosophy on microtransactions in MyFACTION.

WWE 2K26 Designer Says They Try To Provide Extra Benefits for Players Who Pay for MyFACTION Content

Interview with VGC, Terrell Carter, MyFACTION‚Äôs lead designer, explains that he and the team try to give players an extra benefit for spending real-world money.

Internally, the hope is that they don‚Äôt make players feel they have to make purchases like that to use any of the game‚Äôs features. Still, if the purchase is made, they want them to feel there is as much upside as possible.

‚ÄúSo we try to give more content based on those things, rather than be ultra restrictive. Hopefully, it doesn‚Äôt feel ultra-restrictive to the players,‚Äù he said.

Team Chemistry is A Major Feature in This Year‚Äôs MyFACTION Mode

2K recently announced that a new mechanic called team chemistry would be a major focal point of this year‚Äôs MyFACTION. With 60 in-game traits that can have positive and negative effects on your team, there are plenty of scenarios that will play out depending on your specific team‚Äôs chemistry.

For example, Carter says that if your team has bad chemistry, it could fall apart when Partners refuse to tag each other. Luckily, there‚Äôs a way to circumvent that: a new teleport option this year that draws on fighting games like Marvel vs. Capcom and places them in the WWE environment. Learn more about that here.

Are you excited for WWE 2K26? Sound off in our official Discord server. For more WWE 2K26, learn about this year‚Äôs story mode. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

MOBILE APP

item.title: Toronto KOI Ends CDL Losing Streak After Roster Change
item.content:encoded:
Toronto KOI has just secured a win after an eight-match losing streak in the Call of Duty League. The team managed to produce a huge 3-0 sweep over Minnesota G2, putting out something of a masterclass while flexing the new talent in the recently promoted Kips. The young competitor came up from Challengers, departing the Huntsmen and moving into the League.

It was a much-needed victory for Toronto KOI, especially in the run-up to Major II, which will take place in the United Kingdom for the first time in six years.

Toronto KOI Manages to Secure a Win

Toronto KOI, which rebranded ahead of this season after dropping the Ultra moniker, has pulled off a sweep against Minnesota G2. The Call of Duty League has not been kind to Toronto KOI this season, and the team currently sits in 10th place in the overall season standings.

That being said, today‚Äôs fixture against G2 could be an indicator of things to come, now that Kips has taken up a spot on the roster after moving up from the Huntsmen. To make space for him, Reeal was pushed out.

Kips admitted in a post-match interview that his first series with Toronto, which was a 0-3 loss to FaZe Vegas, was him getting his feet wet. He now has a win under his belt in the Call of Duty League, and it was secured against a Minnesota side that hasn‚Äôt been performing too badly of late.

Minnesota went on something of a run at Major I in Dallas, Texas, in January. The squad pushed FaZe Vegas into the lower bracket and eliminated Miami Heretics from the tournament before falling in a very close redemption series against FaZe.

Toronto‚Äôs next fixture will be next Saturday against Miami Heretics, followed by a series against Paris Gentle Mates, this season‚Äôs Major I champion side. Will Toronto remain resilient?

Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you‚Äôre enjoying the Call of Duty League this season.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that FURIA has dropped its Rainbow Six roster

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more‚Ä¶

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: New Xbox CEO Responds to Fan‚Äôs Desire For Console Exclusives
item.content:encoded:
Asha Sharma hears fans‚Äô concerns and desires for console-exclusive video games.

Asha Sharma was promoted to Microsoft Gaming CEO as part of a restructuring on Friday, February 20, 2026. Sarah Bond, former Xbox president, has resigned from the company, and Phil Spencer, longtime Xbox head, has retired from Microsoft after nearly 40 years.

With her appointment to the top of Microsoft Gaming signaling the beginning of a new era for Xbox one gamer tweeted her to ask for the return of console exclusives. Sharma responded with, ‚ÄúHear you.‚Äù She also responded to someone‚Äôs list of the top 3 Xbox exclusive franchises.

Recently, Microsoft has begun porting games from its Studios to other platforms as it continues to push the idea that most pieces of tech can be an Xbox.

Asha Sharma Wants to Bring About ‚ÄòThe Return of Xbox‚Äô

In a memo she issued following her appointment as Microsoft gaming CEO, Sharma emphasized that her first commitment is to ensure there are great games for Microsoft-owned studios. Her second initiative focuses on ‚Äúthe return of Xbox.‚Äù Specifically, she wants to spearhead a recommitment to core Xbox fans and players.

‚ÄúWe will celebrate our roots with a renewed commitment to Xbox starting with console which has shaped who we are. It connects us to the players and fans who invest in Xbox, and to the developers who build ambitious experiences for it,‚Äù she wrote.

Sharma is the former head of CoreAI at Microsoft. Read her comments on AI in gaming at this link. You can read her complete memo regarding her promotion by clicking here.

What do you think, could we see the return of Xbox-exclusive video games? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: PlayStation 6 ‚Äì Everything We Know About Sony‚Äôs Next-Gen Console So Far
item.content:encoded:
Sony hasn't officially announced the PlayStation 6 yet, but that hasn't stopped the rumor mill from churning out an increasingly steady stream of leaks, insider reports, and solid hints from the company itself. With the PlayStation 5 well into the latter half of its lifecycle and the PS5 Pro already on shelves, the attention of hardcore gamers is increasingly turning toward whatever comes next.

Here is everything we know so far about the PlayStation 6, from its release window and hardware to pricing, design, and the possibility of an entirely new PlayStation handheld launching alongside it. Read this article with the significant caveat that most of this info is likely still in flux and may not even have been finalized by Sony itself yet. We'll continue updating this article up to the console's release whenever significant new information becomes available.

Release Date and Pricing

Sony has maintained a remarkably consistent console release cadence: the PS3 launched in 2006, the PS4 in 2013, and the PS5 in November 2020, a seemingly near-perfect seven-year gap each time. Applying that pattern to the PS5 points to a 2027 release window for the PS6, and that was the most widely cited target among leakers, chiefly YouTuber Moore's Law Is Dead (MLID) and renowned AMD insider KeplerL2. However, in January 2026, MST International senior analyst David Gibson warned that while Sony's existing memory inventory would shield it from the short-term impact of rising RAM prices, increased costs could become a serious issue in the fiscal year ending March 2027, and noted that the PS6's release is therefore "likely to be delayed longer than many expected."

Then, on February 15, 2026, Bloomberg published an even more alarming report citing anonymous sources familiar with Sony's PlayStation 6 plans. The report stated that Sony is now "considering pushing back the debut of its next PlayStation console to 2028 or even 2029", still largely due to the ongoing memory shortage that has no end in sight. If true, this could mark the longest gap between PlayStation consoles to date, while also giving Microsoft a chance to capitalize on with its next Xbox console, which is still reportedly targeting a late 2027 release window.

Pricing is one of the most uncertain aspects of the already still nebulous PS6 picture, and the RAM shortage has complicated things further. The PS5 launched at $499 for the standard edition, but with rising production costs, the PS6 is highly unlikely to match that price point. Most estimates from credible sources currently place the PS6 between $500 and $600, though some industry observers have pushed that estimate as high as $700‚Äì$900 depending on the memory situation and model configuration. The PS5 Pro's $699 launch price in 2024 may have been responsible for setting a new psychological ceiling for PlayStation hardware.

Hardware Specifications

Sony's continued partnership with AMD since the days of the PS4 is one of the few hardware details confirmed with high confidence. Reuters reported in September 2024 that Intel had lost out on a bid to design the PS6 chipset back in 2022, with AMD winning the contract. This makes sense from a backward-compatibility standpoint, since the PS5 and PS5 Pro are both built on custom AMD silicon.

Leaked specifications, primarily from the aforementioned leaks shared by MLID and Kepler_L2, point to a custom APU featuring:

  • Manufacturing node: TSMC N2 (2nm), delivering substantial efficiency gains over the PS5's 7nm process.
  • CPU: AMD Zen 6 architecture, offering a substantial leap from the Zen 2 found in both the PS5 and PS5 Pro, which should dramatically reduce the CPU bottleneck issues seen in demanding titles.
  • Memory: It is expected that the PS6 will feature GDDR7 RAM offering approximately 640 GB/s bandwidth, which would be a 43% increase over the PS5's 448 GB/s, though using a narrower 160-bit memory bus rather than the PS5's 256-bit bus, with the speed difference compensating for the reduced bus width. Total RAM capacity has not been reliably leaked yet.
  • GPU: AMD's next-generation RDNA 5 GPU architecture, which will be used by both PS6 and the next Xbox. Though, according to KeplerL2, the new PlayStation console won't feature the full RDNA 5 feature set that will be available on desktop graphics cards.
  • Rasterization Performance: Multiple leaks from MLID and KeplerL2 indicate roughly three times the rasterization performance of the base PS5, with the teraflop count rising from 10.28 TFlops for the PS5 (and 18.05 TFlops for the PS5 Pro) to 34-40 TFlops for the PS6.
  • Ray Tracing Performance: This is supposedly the big focus of the PlayStation 6 console. Thanks to the advancements planned for RDNA 5, ray tracing performance could increase by a massive 6-12x compared to the PlayStation 5.

Some of those advancements were actually co-developed by AMD and Sony through the so-called Project Amethyst, a machine learning-focused initiative. Originally announced in late 2024, Project Amethyst received a major update in October 2025, when AMD unveiled three key technologies that PlayStation 6 System Architect Mark Cerny practically confirmed will be in the new console:

  • Neural Arrays: A new approach to grouping GPU compute units so they can work together as a single AI engine, enabling better upscaling and denoising at lower cost to GPU performance. This was described as a fundamental improvement to technologies like Sony's PSSR.
  • Radiance Cores: A new dedicated hardware block designed for ray and path tracing, taking full control of ray traversal (one of the most compute-heavy tasks currently handled inefficiently across shared resources) and freeing the GPU's shader cores for their primary functions. Cerny noted: "There's a significant speed boost that comes from putting the traversal logic in hardware, and a further boost that comes from that hardware operating independently from the shader cores."
  • Universal Compression: A software layer that compresses data of all types (not just specific file formats, as in current solutions) as it flows through the graphics pipeline, effectively boosting available memory bandwidth. AMD's Jack Huynh, SVP and GM of Computing and Graphics Group, described memory bandwidth limitations as a key barrier to next-gen rendering techniques, and Universal Compression is intended to address that without requiring an expensive hardware memory upgrade.

There's no info yet on the storage. On the connectivity side, support for the new HDMI 2.2 specification (which allows resolutions up to 10K at 120Hz, 4K at up to 480Hz, and 8K at up to 240Hz) and USB4 Version 2.0 seem like a given, especially if the delay rumors turn out to be correct.

PlayStation 6 Handheld: Project "Canis"

One of the most unexpected elements of the PlayStation 6 conversation is the strong rumor that Sony is planning to launch a dedicated gaming handheld alongside, or shortly after, the PS6 home console. This would be quite the surprise for PlayStation handheld fans, who had almost given up on the idea of a new handheld console after the resounding failure of the PS Vita.

Bloomberg first reported in 2024 that Sony was exploring a gaming handheld, internally dubbed "Project Canis." Since then, leaked AMD documentation uncovered by MLID has added substantial hardware detail, and multiple leakers have corroborated the device's existence. Sony has also updated its PS5 developer kits to prioritize "Low Power Mode" support, with documentation suggesting developers ensure their games can run on just eight CPU threads. Multiple sources have since interpreted this as Sony quietly preparing the software ecosystem for handheld hardware.

Project Canis Tentative Specs

  • Chip: Monolithic APU built on TSMC 3nm of approximately 135mm¬≤.
  • CPU: 4x Zen 6c cores for games + 2x low-power Zen 6 cores dedicated to the OS. The OS offload reportedly frees roughly 20% additional CPU headroom for games.
  • GPU: 16 RDNA 5 compute units, clocking around 1.20 GHz in handheld mode and 1.65 GHz when docked.
  • Memory: LPDDR5X on a 192-bit controller, with theoretical support for up to 48GB; no solid figure has been confirmed, though developers consulted on the matter suggested anything between 24 ‚Äì36GB would be necessary to run next-gen games with features such as UE5's Nanite.
  • Performance: Roughly half the raw rasterization power of the base PS5, but with notably stronger ray tracing performance due to the RDNA 5 architectural improvements. Docked rasterization performance could be around 0.55 ‚Äì 0.75√ó PS5, while ray tracing could land at 1.3 ‚Äì 2.6√ó PS5 thanks to RDNA 5's efficiency gains.

Some PlayStation gamers have worried that the handheld could "hold back" new PlayStation 6 games, but according to Massive Damage's Art Director Bryan Heemskerk, PS6 games are more likely to be held back by PC ports.

PlayStation 6 Games

This is by far the most speculative paragraph of the whole article, at least at the time of the original publication, for a very simple reason: it's way too early, and no PS6 games have been formally announced yet. That said, we can make a few educated guesses based on the known development timelines.

First in line would obviously be Intergalactic: the Heretic Prophet, Naughty Dog's new sci-fi IP. It's been a long time since we got a new game from the studio (The Last of Us Part II launched in June 2020), and that's largely because Naughty Dog famously canceled The Last of Us Online in December 2023 because it didn't want to become bound to the live service development cycle.

Intergalactic: the Heretic Prophet won't launch before 2027, according to Bloomberg's Jason Schreier. It will definitely launch on PlayStation 5, but it could be a prime candidate for a PS6 version when the PlayStation 6 eventually hits the market.

The same goes for most of the big games that are tentatively scheduled for 2027-2028:

  • Creative Assembly's Alien Isolation sequel
  • Ubisoft's Assassin's Creed Hexe
  • Cloud Chamber's BioShock 4
  • Larian's Divinity
  • Bethesda's The Elder Scrolls VI
  • Square Enix's Final Fantasy VII Remake Part 3
  • Avalanche Software's Hogwarts Legacy 2
  • 4A Games' Metro Exodus sequel
  • Respawn's Star Wars Jedi Part 3
  • Ubisoft's Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell Remake
  • Ubisoft's Tom Clancy's The Division 3
  • Saber's Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 3
  • CD Projekt RED's The Witcher IV
  • CD Projekt RED's + Fool Theory's The Witcher Remake

All these games will likely be cross-generation, offering a PlayStation 6 version with additional bells and whistles at some point. The cross-gen phenomenon was already huge between PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5, and given current industry trends, it's only going to get larger.

As for true PS6-only titles, it will take a very long time for those. Maybe the next Mass Effect, the freshly announced Star Wars: Fate of the Old Republic, and the God of War remake trilogy will qualify. Needless to say, we'll slowly update this section (as with the others) once more concrete details become available. Stay tuned.



https://wccftech.com/roundup/playstation-6-everything-we-know-release-date-specs-price-games/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: New Xbox Boss Says ‚ÄòHear You‚Äô When Asked To Bring Back Exclusives
item.content:encoded:
Freshly minted Microsoft Gaming CEO Asha Sharma has kicked off the newest era of Xbox leadership with an open thread on Elon Musk‚Äôs social media platform. Coming from Microsoft‚Äôs AI division, the former marketer with little experience in gaming faces a wave of skepticism from fans at the exact moment when trust in the Xbox brand has never been more challenged following waves of developer layoffs, game cancellations, and studio closures.

She began with a simple question to her influx of new gaming followers. ‚ÄúTop 3 greatest games ever? Why? GO‚Äù reads her second post on X since replacing outgoing 38-year Microsoft veteran Phil Spencer. ‚ÄúFor me it‚Äôs Halo, Valheim, Goldeneye,‚Äù she told one user. Others asked which Halo. An Xbox Gamertag Sharma shared with another user included playtime in both Halo Infinite and Halo: The Master Chief Collection.

New #Xbox CEO Asha Sharma has now publicly shared her Gamertag. She has a 10,860 gamerscore and seemingly only started playing on Xbox or this GT one month ago.

She (or whomever runs the account) has played 29 games in the span of that month. pic.twitter.com/3EMvDVLNo3

‚Äî NIB (@nib95_) February 21, 2026

The account has a shocking number of achievements in Ball x Pit, one of 2025‚Äôs breakout indie games that debuted on Game Pass. One user recommended Borderlands 2 which Sharma said she would try. A short time later, it appeared on her recent activity list. For some it‚Äôs a sign that the executive from Meta and Instacart is engaged, accessible, and no stranger to games. Others are skeptical that it‚Äôs not all just part of some carefully and artificially curated PR rollout.

Amid the more than one thousand responses, Sharma was asked the obvious question on most Xbox players‚Äô minds: what about exclusives? Microsoft‚Äôs shift from fierce console war competition with Sony to actively porting its biggest franchises to PlayStation 5 has read to many long-time fans as a betrayal and, perhaps even worse, a sign that the tech giant has given up on Xbox as a viable contender in the console gaming space.

Hear you

‚Äî Asha (@asha_shar) February 21, 2026

‚ÄúHi Asha Sharma, as the new Xbox CEO I hope that you understand how important exclusive games are and how games like Halo, Forza, Gears. Fable‚Ä¶ Created an identity for Xbox and its players becoming a key point for Xbox‚Äôs success,‚Äù wrote one player with a Gamerscore over 200,000. ‚ÄúXbox games must be only on Xbox.‚Äù

‚ÄúHear you,‚Äù she wrote back.

The sentiment, vague and noncommittal as it was, instantly gave some hope to the diehard Xbox fans in Sharma‚Äôs mentions. Others think it‚Äôs just a cheap way to buy a little good will before Microsoft accelerates Xbox‚Äôs pivot to being just a third-party publisher or moves forward with more cuts and closures as the tech giant continues shifting all of its resources and energy into the AI race.

Elsewhere in the informal Q&A, some users on X accused Sharma‚Äôs answers of being written by a chatbot. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe you,‚Äù wrote one person. ‚ÄúIn fact, I think your account is an AI.‚Äù The new CEO of Xbox responded: ‚ÄúBeep Boop Beep Boop.‚Äù



https://kotaku.com/xbox-exclusives-halo-asha-sharma-microsoft-2000672587
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Midsummer Studios Shuts Down Less Than 2 Years After Launch
item.content:encoded:
Midsummer Studios has closed, but not before giving a look at a life simulator that the team was working on.

The studio was founded by XCOM designer Jake Solomon, and it was Solomon who shared on social media that the studio was closing its doors but wanted to provide a look at a game called Burbank. According to Solomon, the game was a mix of The Sims and The Truman Show, the film starring Jim Carrey that focused on a man discovering that his life was a television series.

‚ÄúWe built a studio, we made a game, and I‚Äôm really proud of both,‚Äù wrote Solomon. ‚ÄúThis game was a dream of mine, our team made it come true, so watch and dream with us,‚Äù he said in his post.

Jake Solomon later stated in a social media post that the characters in the pre-alpha trailer he shared were generated by AI. However, he insists that the studio had no intention of replacing any developers with AI.

‚ÄúOur characters use AI for memory, reasoning and speech. That‚Äôs what let‚Äôs you create anyone you want and drop them in any story you write. But all of our art is created by our talented artists. We had no interest in replacing any developers with AI,‚Äù he wrote.

History of Midsummer Studios

The studio opened in 2024, with Solomon partnering with Will Miller, the lead designer at Firaxis Games, and Leslie Birch. Less than 2 years later, it is closed. The studio launched with $6 million in funding from investors.

The initial press release announcing the company states that Transcend Fund led the way, with participation from Tirta Ventures, Betaworks Ventures, 1 Up Ventures, F4 Fund, Krafton, and Day Zero Productions.

The major life simulator was the company‚Äôs main game.

There are even more major shakeups in the game industry. Recently, Ubisoft Toronto confirmed that it had laid off 40 employees.

Xbox is also undergoing a massive restructuring, following Phil Spencer‚Äôs recent retirement and Sarah Bond‚Äôs resignation from the company. Learn more about that restructuring here.

What do you think about the footage from Burbank? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

item.title: Original Saints Row Designer Believes The Series Is Dead After Publisher Ghosts Him
item.content:encoded:
The original Saints Row was an unexpected hit. Rising above the tide of urban sandboxes in 2006, the game pushed its tomfoolery further than even Grand Theft Auto dared. The most recent entry, however, was a misfire. 2022‚Äôs reboot was busted from a technical standpoint and tonally out of sync for fans. Last year, rumors arose that the series might get another shot, but Chris Stockman, design director for the original game, now says the long-running Row has a fork in it.

‚ÄúI think the franchise is dead, unfortunately,‚Äù Stockman told a fan on Discord (via Eurogamer). ‚ÄúI get the sense that Embracer has zero ability to do anything with it.‚Äù

Though Stockman hadn‚Äôt been with Saints Row developer Volition for years, he claimed last November that Embracer Group approached him to help with a course correction for the franchise. The pitch, as he described it, was a Saints Row prequel set in the 1970s. This new setting could have done a more balanced job of giving Saints Row a desperately needed fresh coat, while affording itself ample opportunities for its signature buffoonery.

Remember when we got excited about the prospect of a Saints Row prequel? Well according to Saints Row 1 Design Director Chris Stockman, Embracer is completely ignoring the idea.

Saints Row is once again dead. https://t.co/cpPVcRjxwD pic.twitter.com/FWpjC6kmkT

‚Äî rpg! (@papaRPG) February 20, 2026

Promising as that was, it did not get very far. Only a few months later, Stockman now believes he is being ‚Äúghosted‚Äù by Embracer and that it‚Äôs probably the end of the road for Saints Row‚Äôs 20-year joy ride. ‚ÄúI wish things were different,‚Äù he wrote.

While it‚Äôs since become the norm, Embracer Group were one of the earlier conglomerates who got into the practice of hoovering up game studios and squeezing them dry. They‚Äôve toyed around with portfolios like Gearbox, Crystal Dynamics, THQ and dozens more, all to mixed results. Their acquisition of Volition occurred in 2018, part of a package in the purchase of Koch Media. The 2022 reboot would be the only game Volition made under Embracer, developed under routine restructuring and staff transfers between other studios. When this banged-up Saints Row failed to meet sales expectations, Volition was shuttered by Embracer in 2023.

This end is merely another page in the book of Embracer squashing out potential sequels, having recently binned revivals for Perfect Dark and Deus Ex before that. Having picked up Crystal Dynamics in 2022, their first outing with the Tomb Raider series is already facing turbulence as Embracer enacts their signature restructuring.



https://kotaku.com/saints-row-6-reboot-chris-stockman-embracer-2000672582
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Today‚Äôs Wordle #1709: Hints and Answer for February 22, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a daily player, today‚Äôs tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak‚Äîif you‚Äôre open to a little extra help. So, if you‚Äôve found yourself stuck with today‚Äôs Wordle, don‚Äôt worry, below you‚Äôll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1709 for February 22, 2026

To play today‚Äôs Wordle, head to the game‚Äôs website. If you want to go right to today‚Äôs answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today‚Äôs and yesterday‚Äôs editions of Wordle. If you don‚Äôt want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, February 22, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1709 will give you a challenge. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today‚Äôs answer takes an average of 4.6 out of 6 guesses. That makes it just slightly easier than the 5-guess average from February 21.

General Wordle Hints For February 22

Without giving today‚Äôs Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word refers to a specific type of item, not a category or action.
  • Hint 2: It‚Äôs most often encountered in food-related contexts.
  • Hint 3: The word is more common in menus or descriptions than everyday conversation.
  • Hint 4: You‚Äôre more likely to see it used when something is being identified or highlighted, not casually mentioned.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1709 for February 22, 2026.

Starter Words For February 22, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today‚Äôs Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • GUARD
  • FRUIT
  • VAULT
  • AGAVE
  • NAVAL

Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer For Game #1709 On February 22, 2026

If you‚Äôve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today‚Äôs Wordle below.

Answer: GUAVA

If you solved today‚Äôs Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow‚Äôs puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today‚Äôs Wordle Answer Mean?

GUAVA is a noun that means ‚Äúany of numerous tropical and subtropical American trees or shrubs belonging to the genus Psidium, of the myrtle family, especially P. guajava, bearing large, yellow, round to pear-shaped fruit, and P. littorale, bearing smaller, yellowish to deep-red, oval fruit.‚Äù

Yesterday‚Äôs Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here‚Äôs yesterday‚Äôs Wordle answer for Game #1708 on February 21, 2026

Answer: AWAKE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1709?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 23 will be Wordle Game #1710.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn‚Äôt fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of‚Ä¶

More from Mike Straw

item.title: Ubisoft Promises Two Far Cry Games Are Coming As Open-World Shooter Continues Its Longest Hiatus Ever
item.content:encoded:
Far Cry 7 was not supposed to take this long, but Ubisoft CEO Yves Guillemot is promising the wait will be worth it. Asked about the state of the publisher‚Äôs biggest franchises and why they‚Äôre taking so long to make in a recent interview, the cofounder took the unusual step of confirming the existence of two previously reported upcoming Far Cry projects.

‚ÄúWe have a solid pipeline underway across Vantage Studios,‚Äù he told Variety this week. ‚ÄúUnder the Assassin‚Äôs Creed brand, several titles are in development, spanning both single-player and multiplayer experiences, with the ambition to further grow a community that exceeded 30 million players last year. On Far Cry, anticipation is high, and we currently have two very promising projects in development.‚Äù

The existence of both of these projects was first reported back in early 2023. Far Cry 7 was being developed under the codename Project Blackbird while the second game, a multiplayer spin-off, was being developed under the codename Project Maverick. While Ubisoft mentioned both games in internal presentations at the time as the company doubled down on its biggest franchises, they continue to face delays and remain MIA as the company tries to implement quality checks with higher standards.

Why is Far Cry 7 taking so long?

Historically, big Far Cry sequels have come out every two to three years, with smaller spin-offs releasing in-between. Since Ubisoft bought the franchise and launched Far Cry 2 back in 2008, the longest gap between new entries has been four years. It will have been five years since Far Cry 6 released come this fall. A similar breakdown in the pipeline has hit other major Ubisoft franchises as it gets more complex and expensive to develop AAA blockbusters.

As Insider Gaming reports, the Far Cry multiplayer spin-off Maverick in particular has faced major challenges. While it started as an extraction shooter, Maverick has continued to evolve and morph during development. While Ubisoft has continued to produce impressive, massive open-world single-player adventures, its forays into multiplayer have gone terribly. From Hyper Scape to XDefiant, and all of the botched and canceled live service projects in-between, Ubisoft has been unable to recreate the success of its biggest multiplayer staple, Rainbow Six Siege.

‚ÄúSeveral‚Äù Assassin‚Äôs Creed games are just around the corner

On the Assassin‚Äôs Creed front, the path forward is looking much clearer. An unannounced remake of Assassin‚Äôs Creed IV: Black Flag appears to still be on track for release in 2026 despite a recent delay. The previously teased multiplayer spin-off Invictus is also still ‚Äúlocked-in,‚Äù according to Insider Gaming, with the next single-player game, Hexe, reportedly slated for 2027. Multiple unannounced mobile spin-offs were recently canceled, however, and a mobile game from Netflix called Jade seems unlikely to ever see the light of day as the streamer pivots to licensed party games.

Whatever happens to Ubisoft as it partitions its sprawling empire of studios into easily sellable ‚ÄúCreative Houses,‚Äù Far Cry and Assassin‚Äôs Creed will remain cornerstones of whatever‚Äôs left. There‚Äôs already a Far Cry TV series in development at FX and a new Assassin‚Äôs Creed historical drama coming to Netflix. All Ubisoft has to do is actually release a new Far Cry game at some point while bringing some excitement and shine back to Assassin‚Äôs Creed.



https://kotaku.com/far-cry-7-extraction-shooter-assassins-creed-hexe-ubisoft-2000672574

item.title: Slay the Spire 2 Early Access Release Date Set
item.content:encoded:
The day that Slay the Spire 2 will enter Early Access has been confirmed. Thankfully, for fans of the beloved roguelike deckbuilder, they won‚Äôt have to wait long.

Slay the Spire 2 enters Steam Early Access on Thursday, March 5, 2026, 12 days from this writing. Mega Crit announced the news in a YouTube trailer.

This is the long-awaited follow-up to the game that helped solidify the roguelike deckbuilder genre. Shore, some may feel like they‚Äôre a dime a dozen these days, but Slay the Spire 2 gets the opportunity to finally build on what the original game brought to the table in 2019.

Slay the Spire 2 Was Originally Set for a 2025 Release

The sequel to 2019‚Äôs Slay the Spire was originally scheduled for an Early Access release in late 2025. However, in September, Mega Crit announced it would delay the game to uphold its own quality standards.

Such improvements will include a new 4-player co-op mode, complete with specific multiplayer cards and new team synergies. Learn more about the new developments and updates here.

Insider Gaming will provide more information on the upcoming Slay the Spire sequel as Early Access approaches.

Are you excited for this next entry in the roguelike deckbuilding genre? With the release of games like Resident Evil Requiem, Slay the Spire 2, and WWE 2K26 all coming within the next couple of weeks, what games are you prioritizing? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Nexon snaps up Arc Raiders' Patrick S√∂derlund as executive chairman to "lead the next phase of growth" for the company
item.content:encoded:
"I'm ready to get to work."

Patrick S√∂derlund ‚Äì founder and CEO of Arc Raiders studio, Embark ‚Äì has been appointed as executive chairman at Nexon to "accelerate global strategy, transform creative direction, and lead the next phase of growth" for its parent company.

Fresh from the success of Arc Raiders, S√∂derlund will now be working "closely with [Nexon] CEO Junghun Lee and the executive leadership team", setting the "strategic direction" that Lee will then implement.

It's not entirely clear if this position comes in addition to S√∂derlund's already pretty meaty role leading Embark ‚Äì which is owned by Nexon ‚Äì or is in place of it, but it appears to be the former.

"Nexon has all the assets to unleash dramatic growth ‚Äì incredibly talented people, iconic franchises, large and committed player communities, and best-in-class live service capabilities," S√∂derlund said via a press statement.

"This is an enormous opportunity, but one that will require deep focus and discipline. [Nexon CEO] Junghun and I are aligned on what needs to happen, and I'm ready to get to work."

It's a huge appointment for Nexon, which ‚Äì although bobbing along just fine with its immensely popular mobile titles like MapleStory ‚Äì has failed to get a bite of the live-service sector, and chiefly dabbled in casual and mobile gaming until subsidiary Mintrocket released the hugely successful Dave the Diver in 2023. It also published Embark Studios' inaugural title, The Finals, that same year, and the middling The First Descendant in 2024.

As we reported earlier this week, Arc Raiders continues to impress, nearing almost 1m concurrent players on PC alone and pushing onwards with events and regular updates planned out until April.

It has also started to grapple with the consequences of that massive duplication glitch that allowed cheeky players to double anything they were holding in their hands, confirming it has finished a large investigation into how the recent exploits and glitches came to be and how to deal with offenders now and in the future.

Related topics

item.title: Hackers Raise The Alarm About Discord‚Äôs Recent Age-Verification Partner
item.content:encoded:
Last week, Discord users reported seeing prompts to submit personal information to Persona, a third-party age-verification service. As Discord commits to universal age-verification, the new measures have come under intense scrutiny after previous security failures. Now a trio of hacktivists say they‚Äôve successfully breached Persona, getting a closer look at how the company uses submitted biometrics. They say their findings raise alarms beyond the possibility of leaks.

According to The Rage, Persona‚Äôs front-end security left a lot to be desired. Worse, however, were investigative findings that suggested Persona‚Äôs surveillance of the users whose data it collected was way more sprawling than originally believed.  

‚ÄúIt was initially meant to be a passive recon investigation,‚Äù writes vmfunc, a cybersecurity researcher and one of the hackers, ‚Äúthat quickly turned into a rabbit hole deep dive into how commercial AI and federal government operations work together to violate our privacy every waking second.‚Äù

I'm sharing all email correspondences between @vmfunc and myself in advance of @vmfunc's later blog posts because without context, a signed statement from myself has only created more conspiracy theories regarding Persona. pic.twitter.com/nDJorLEP4H

‚Äî Rick Song (@rickcsong) February 19, 2026

On top of finding it surprisingly easy to access data gathered by Persona, the research showed that faces and biometrics were not just being scanned for age verification, but flagged for suspicious behavior and bounced off watchlists as well. To some, particularly those who don‚Äôt worry about their face being deemed ‚Äúsuspicious,‚Äù this may not sound like an Orwellian level of intrusion, until you remember Persona‚Äôs full network.

Persona received $150 million in 2021 from the Founders Fund, a long-running tech investor group headed by Peter Thiel. Thiel‚Äôs main business, on top of palling around in Jeffery Epstein‚Äôs emails and waiting for the antichrist, is Palantir, an intentionally ominously-named data brokering service that is currently peddling user information to support ICE raids. The findings of vmfunc and co‚Äôs research doesn‚Äôt directly tether Persona and Discord‚Äôs operations to Palantir or Thiel, but it wouldn‚Äôt be conspiratorial to point out that all this data seems to be funnelling along similar slopes.

Trust but verify

Persona has confirmed the breach, CEO Rick Song corresponding and even thanking the hackers for flagging the security exploit. This has not, however, tempered concerns among those hacktivists about how the user information is ultimately being used.

‚ÄúTransparently, we are actively working on a couple of potential contracts which would be publicly visible if we move forward,‚Äù writes Christie Kim, chief operating officer at Persona, in an email regarding the security breach and speculation around Discord. ‚ÄúHowever, these engagements are strictly for workforce account security of government employees and do not include ICE or any agency within the Department of Homeland Security.‚Äù

After the alarm was initially raised about Persona, Discord claimed its work with the Thiel-backed firm was only temporary, and that it didn‚Äôt have new contacts with it moving forward. It also promised user info was being wiped from servers within seven days of being gathered. 

In a statement provided to Kotaku, Discord said the ‚Äúlimited test‚Äù had concluded, though what Persona does with the information in that period isn‚Äôt clarified. It seems to go much further than verifying which PlayStation you grew up with. Even after the dust settles, it‚Äôs unclear if the trust can ever be repaired as an exodus of Discord users have already flooded alternatives like TeamSpeak.



https://kotaku.com/discord-age-verification-hack-persona-2000672570
